page.title: 18Leamland Travel
page.content: We interviewed a member of staff at Leamland Coach Travel and we have compiled our findings to describe their publicity and information systems. There are three shops, a garage, a headquarters in Hassocks and a transport depot. They publicise by putting leaflets through people's doors and by advertising in local magazines and newspapers. The Hassocks office controls 16 coaches. Their office equipment consists of photocopiers, computers and a large telephone system. The computers are an Apricot, a Cado and an Apple. They have the Cado computer at Sayers Common. They employ 35 staff. The office has been in Hassocks for about 3 years.
